## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

## General code for all sessions


```{r}
#| label: install
#| echo: true

options(repos="https://cran.rstudio.com")



# General markdown, tidyverse
install.packages("markdown")
install.packages("rmarkdown")

install.packages("knitr")

install.packages("tidyverse")


```

## Specific code for sections

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| label: install-packages-specific
#| echo: true

# Unfiled

install.packages("haven")

install.packages("epiDisplay")

install.packages("gmodels")

install.packages("foreign")

install.packages("Hmisc")

install.packages("car")

install.packages("corrplot")

install.packages("GGally")

install.packages("vioplot")

install.packages("forestplot")

install.packages("foreign")

install.packages("gt")

install.packages("expss")

# Datasets session 2

install.packages("here")

install.packages("nhanesA")

install.packages("sjlabelled")

# Descriptive statistics session 3

install.packages("gtsummary")

install.packages("flextable")

# Graphing session 4

install.packages("ggplot2")

install.packages("ggpubr")

install.packages("vidiris")

install.packages("RColorBrewer")

# Hypothesis testing session 5

install.packages("infer")

install.packages("ggcorrplot")

# Regression packages? session 6

# Advanced session 7

install.packages("survey")

install.packages("rmeta")

```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

## Check install success

```{r}
#| label: check-install-success

library(rmarkdown)
library(knitr)
library(tidyverse)

```
